page.title: 11ALMHOUSES, LEIGHTON BUZZARD.
page.content: 'Beating the Bounds' is a ceremony which has taken place annually since 1683, outside the almshouses in North Street, on Rogation Monday. It complies with the will of a man called John Wilkes who lived in Leighton Buzzard in the 17C. He left the almshouses to the parish church of 'All Saints' to provide a home for old ladies who were widowed or spinsters. The procession leaves 'All Saints' around midday led by a garland bearer who traditionally warded off the smell of the environment. Outside the almshoses extracts from the will of Matthew Wilkes, John's grandson are read and traditionally a member of the choir stands on their head "in order that he or she may understand and retain the words better." The vicar then hands over 50p to each of the retired residents.
